title: Cash Theft from Grocery Shop, Sonipat
summary: ₹12,000 stolen from cash drawer at Corner Grocers during afternoon rush.

stages.info:
Shop drawer opened without transaction.
Temporary worker was present.
CCTV shows him lingering.
stages.question: Most appropriate first step?
options: Conduct staff roster verification + interview all employees present
Arrest temporary worker immediately
Ask owner to check drawer again later
File a DDR only
stages.feedback_wrong: Interview + roster verification avoids premature arrest.
stages.next_info: Worker missing since incident. Phone switched off.

stages.info: CCTV has evidentiary value. Shows worker opening drawer.
stages.question: Next action?
options: Seize CCTV footage formally with hash value & proof of origin
Take photos of CCTV screen and return
Ask owner to preserve footage himself
Ignore footage until worker is found
stages.feedback_wrong: Formal seizure prevents future allegations of tampering.
stages.next_info: Seized CCTV shows worker leaving hurriedly with envelope.

stages.info: Worker’s last phone activity: Murthal tower.
stages.question: Best investigative step?
options: Analyze CDR + last tower location and coordinate with Murthal PP
Visit worker’s Facebook to check recent posts
Call relatives repeatedly
Freeze worker’s bank account immediately
stages.feedback_wrong: CDR + coordination gives actionable geographic leads.
stages.next_info: Family in Ganaur confirms he returned with extra cash.

stages.info: Family confirms boy returned home with envelope.
stages.question: Next step?
options: Conduct lawful search/recovery as per procedure
Threaten family members to produce him
Wait for him to come voluntarily
Call media persons
stages.feedback_wrong: Recovery must follow proper CrPC guidelines.

stages.question: Final legal action?
options: Complete arrest & recovery memo and file chargesheet
Release him after warning
Pressure owner to settle
Erase CCTV to avoid storing evidence
